rip2.name: rip2
rip2.contactinfo: Fred Baker Postal: Cisco Systems 519 Lado Drive Santa Barbara, California 93111 Tel: +1 805 681 0115 E-Mail: fbaker@cisco.com Postal: Gary Malkin Xylogics, Inc. 53 Third Avenue Burlington, MA 01803 Phone: (617) 272-8140 EMail: gmalkin@Xylogics.COM
rip2.description: The MIB module to describe the RIP2 Version 2 Protocol

RouteTag.name: RouteTag
RouteTag.description: the RouteTag type represents the contents of the Route Domain field in the packet header or route entry

rip2GlobalRouteChanges.name: rip2GlobalRouteChanges
rip2GlobalRouteChanges.description: The number of route changes made to the IP Route Database by RIP. This does not include the refresh of a route's age.

rip2GlobalQueries.name: rip2GlobalQueries
rip2GlobalQueries.description: The number of responses sent to RIP queries from other systems.

rip2IfStatTable.name: rip2IfStatTable
rip2IfStatTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate status monitoring in RIP.

rip2IfStatEntry.name: rip2IfStatEntry
rip2IfStatEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet.

rip2IfStatAddress.name: rip2IfStatAddress
rip2IfStatAddress.description: The IP Address of this system on the indicated subnet. For unnumbered interfaces, the value 0.0.0.N, where the least significant 24 bits (N) is the ifIndex for the IP Interface in network byte order.

rip2IfStatRcvBadPackets.name: rip2IfStatRcvBadPackets
rip2IfStatRcvBadPackets.description: The number of RIP response packets received by the RIP process which were subsequently discarded for any reason (e.g. a version 0 packet, or an unknown command type).

rip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes.name: rip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes
rip2IfStatRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes, in valid RIP packets, which were ignored for any reason (e.g. unknown address family, or invalid metric).

rip2IfStatSentUpdates.name: rip2IfStatSentUpdates
rip2IfStatSentUpdates.description: The number of triggered RIP updates actually sent on this interface. This explicitly does NOT include full updates sent containing new information.

rip2IfStatStatus.name: rip2IfStatStatus
rip2IfStatStatus.description: Writing invalid has the effect of deleting this interface.

rip2IfConfTable.name: rip2IfConfTable
rip2IfConfTable.description: A list of subnets which require separate configuration in RIP.

rip2IfConfEntry.name: rip2IfConfEntry
rip2IfConfEntry.description: A Single Routing Domain in a single Subnet.

rip2IfConfAddress.name: rip2IfConfAddress
rip2IfConfAddress.description: The IP Address of this system on the indicated subnet. For unnumbered interfaces, the value 0.0.0.N, where the least significant 24 bits (N) is the ifIndex for the IP Interface in network byte order.

rip2IfConfDomain.name: rip2IfConfDomain
rip2IfConfDomain.description: Value inserted into the Routing Domain field of all RIP packets sent on this interface.

rip2IfConfAuthType.name: rip2IfConfAuthType
rip2IfConfAuthType.description: The type of Authentication used on this interface.

rip2IfConfAuthKey.name: rip2IfConfAuthKey
rip2IfConfAuthKey.description: The value to be used as the Authentication Key whenever the corresponding instance of rip2IfConfAuthType has a value other than noAuthentication. A modification of the corresponding instance of rip2IfConfAuthType does not modify the rip2IfConfAuthKey value. If a string shorter than 16 octets is supplied, it will be left- justified and padded to 16 octets, on the right, with nulls (0x00). Reading this object always results in an OCTET STRING of length zero; authentication may not be bypassed by reading the MIB object.

rip2IfConfSend.name: rip2IfConfSend
rip2IfConfSend.description: What the router sends on this interface. ripVersion1 implies sending RIP updates compliant with RFC 1058. rip1Compatible implies broadcasting RIP-2 updates using RFC 1058 route subsumption rules. ripVersion2 implies multicasting RIP-2 updates. ripV1Demand indicates the use of Demand RIP on a WAN interface under RIP Version 1 rules. ripV2Demand indicates the use of Demand RIP on a WAN interface under Version 2 rules.

rip2IfConfReceive.name: rip2IfConfReceive
rip2IfConfReceive.description: This indicates which version of RIP updates are to be accepted. Note that rip2 and rip1OrRip2 implies reception of multicast packets.

rip2IfConfDefaultMetric.name: rip2IfConfDefaultMetric
rip2IfConfDefaultMetric.description: This variable indicates the metric that is to be used for the default route entry in RIP updates originated on this interface. A value of zero indicates that no default route should be originated; in this case, a default route via another router may be propagated.

rip2IfConfStatus.name: rip2IfConfStatus
rip2IfConfStatus.description: Writing invalid has the effect of deleting this interface.

rip2IfConfSrcAddress.name: rip2IfConfSrcAddress
rip2IfConfSrcAddress.description: The IP Address this system will use as a source address on this interface. If it is a numbered interface, this MUST be the same value as rip2IfConfAddress. On unnumbered interfaces, it must be the value of rip2IfConfAddress for some interface on the system.

rip2PeerEntry.name: rip2PeerEntry
rip2PeerEntry.description: Information regarding a single routing peer.

rip2PeerAddress.name: rip2PeerAddress
rip2PeerAddress.description: The IP Address that the peer is using as its source address. Note that on an unnumbered link, this may not be a member of any subnet on the system.

rip2PeerDomain.name: rip2PeerDomain
rip2PeerDomain.description: The value in the Routing Domain field in RIP packets received from the peer. As domain suuport is deprecated, this must be zero.

rip2PeerLastUpdate.name: rip2PeerLastUpdate
rip2PeerLastUpdate.description: The value of sysUpTime when the most recent RIP update was received from this system.

rip2PeerVersion.name: rip2PeerVersion
rip2PeerVersion.description: The RIP version number in the header of the last RIP packet received.

rip2PeerRcvBadPackets.name: rip2PeerRcvBadPackets
rip2PeerRcvBadPackets.description: The number of RIP response packets from this peer discarded as invalid.

rip2PeerRcvBadRoutes.name: rip2PeerRcvBadRoutes
rip2PeerRcvBadRoutes.description: The number of routes from this peer that were ignored because the entry format was invalid.

rip2GlobalGroup.name: rip2GlobalGroup
rip2GlobalGroup.description: This group defines global controls for RIP-II systems.

rip2IfStatGroup.name: rip2IfStatGroup
rip2IfStatGroup.description: This group defines interface statistics for RIP-II systems.

rip2IfConfGroup.name: rip2IfConfGroup
rip2IfConfGroup.description: This group defines interface configuration for RIP-II systems.

rip2PeerGroup.name: rip2PeerGroup
rip2PeerGroup.description: This group defines peer information for RIP-II systems.
